extendedIngredients.name: bulgur
extendedIngredients.original: 2 cups medium or coarsely cracked bulgur*

extendedIngredients.name: lemon juice
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice

extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.original: 20 cooked peeled deveined large shrimp with tails intact
extendedIngredients.originalName: 20 cooked peeled deveined large shrimp with tails intact

title: Mint-Marinated Shrimp with Tabbouleh, Tomatoes, and Feta
summary: Mint-Marinated Shrimp with Tabbouleh, Tomatoes, and Fetan is a pescatarian main course. This recipe serves 4 and costs $2.27 per serving. One serving contains 509 calories, 19g of protein, and 24g of fat. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. It is a rather cheap recipe for fans of middl eastern food. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 45 minutes. Head to the store and pick up shrimp, coarsely cracked bulgur, green onions, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the bulgur you could follow this main course with the Bulgur Pudding with Candied Ginger and Figs as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 69%. This score is good. Try Mint Marinated Grilled Shrimp Tabbouleh Salad, Couscous Tabbouleh with Fresh Mint & Feta, and Cherry Tomatoes Stuffed With Marinated Feta for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. One wine you could try is Menage a Trois Limelight Pinot Grigio. It has 4.5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 11 dollars.

productMatches.title: Menage a Trois Limelight Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Ménage à Trois Limelight shines a spotlight on refreshing citrus flavors in the most dazzling way. Limelight is a new star with sexy orange blossom aromas that lead to zesty key lime and mouthwatering Granny Smith apple flavors that make you pucker up. A touch of honeysuckle sweetness and minerality balance the pronounced citrus notes before the curtains drop with a refreshingly crisp finish.

instructions: Preparation                                                        Stir bulgur, 1 1/2 cups water, 1/2 cup lemon juice, and 1/3 cup oil in large bowl. Let stand until bulgur is tender and most liquid is absorbed, about 2 hours.                                                                Meanwhile, whisk together remaining 2 tablespoons lemon juice, 2 tablespoons oil, 3 tablespoons mint, and 1/2 teaspoon salt in medium bowl. Mix in shrimp. Marinate 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.                                                                Drain off any excess liquid from bulgur. Mix in tomatoes, arugula, feta, green onions, garlic, remaining 3 tablespoons mint, and 1 1/2 teaspoons salt. Season salad to taste with pepper.                                                                Mound salad in large shallow bowl or on individual plates. Spoon shrimp and dressing over and serve.                                                                *Also called cracked wheat; available at supermarkets, specialty foods stores, and natural foods stores.

steps.step: Stir bulgur, 1 1/2 cups water, 1/2 cup lemon juice, and 1/3 cup oil in large bowl.
Let stand until bulgur is tender and most liquid is absorbed, about 2 hours.
Meanwhile, whisk together remaining 2 tablespoons lemon juice, 2 tablespoons oil, 3 tablespoons mint, and 1/2 teaspoon salt in medium bowl.
Mix in shrimp. Marinate 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Drain off any excess liquid from bulgur.
Mix in tomatoes, arugula, feta, green onions, garlic, remaining 3 tablespoons mint, and 1 1/2 teaspoons salt. Season salad to taste with pepper.
Mound salad in large shallow bowl or on individual plates. Spoon shrimp and dressing over and serve.
*Also called cracked wheat; available at supermarkets, specialty foods stores, and natural foods stores.
